title: Software Developer - Consulting Internship
purpose: To support software development projects and assist with requirement gathering, project planning, system documentation, and application testing.
duties_responsibilities: Support software development projects through requirement gathering, project planning, and system documentation
Support the design and creation of software development screens with wireframes and mock-ups
Assist in conceptualizing and developing new business workflows or system processes
Collaborate with project managers in defining project vision, organizing project tasks, and tracking project progress
Contribute to reporting and custom developed IT projects, perform software development testing, unit testing, and debugging
Participate in software testing including Quality Assurance and Quality Control
Support the creation and execution of manual software testing scripts
Communicate obstacles or items of concern to supervisor
Comply with professional and Firm requirements, quality control document requirements, and confidentiality requirements
Attend and actively engage in training sessions or meetings
Maintain a positive attitude and be receptive to feedback
Provide courteous and prompt service to all internal and external parties
Identify opportunities to improve service and work processes
Assist co-workers in the completion of tasks and assignments
May periodically travel and work from different company locations
May be required to work overtime and/or on weekends as needed
required_qualifications: Working towards a Bachelor’s or Masters of Science degree in Computer Science, Information Systems and Decision Sciences, Accounting, Finance or a related field
3.0 GPA is preferred, but not required
Direct experience or education related to Agile software development cycles, software development, design, and/or testing is preferred
Experience or education related to project management, process management is preferred
Experience or education related to technical writing or requirements gathering is preferred
Experience with JIRA, Confluence, or related IT Project Management programs is preferred
Working knowledge of Scrum or other Agile methodologies
Able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative, and continuously changing environment
Excellent communication skills in business and technical environments

company_info.overview: EisnerAmper is one of the largest accounting, tax, and business advisory firms, with nearly 4,000 employees and more than 350 partners across the world. We combine responsiveness with a long-range perspective to help clients meet the pressing issues they face today and position them for success tomorrow.
company_info.mission: To provide exceptional accounting, tax, and business advisory services to clients, and to create a supportive and inclusive work environment for our employees.
company_info.values: Responsiveness, Long-range perspective, Exceptional service, Supportive and inclusive work environment
company_info.way_of_working: EisnerAmper values collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. We encourage our employees to take ownership of their work, communicate effectively, and strive for excellence in everything they do.
